case_title: AYYAZ ANJUM vs GOVERNMENT OF PUNJAB, HOUSING AND PHYSICAL PLANNING DEPARTMENT through Secretary and others
reference_no_or_id: Civil Petition for Leave to Appeal No, 1232-L of 1996; Writ Petition No, 3617 of 1996
respondant: GOVERNMENT OF PUNJAB, HOUSING AND PHYSICAL PLANNING DEPARTMENT through Secretary

accussed_details.name: Muhammad Younis Chohan
accussed_details.designation: Civil Servant in Public Health Engineering Department
allegation: Invoking political influence for favorable posting

complaint_summary: Dispute over inter se transfers between two civil servants alleging political influence for postings.
investigation_summary: High Court called for departmental records and suspended the impugned transfer order dated 13-3-1996.
judgment_summary: Supreme Court ruled that disputes regarding civil servant postings fall under the exclusive jurisdiction of the Service Tribunal as per Article 212(2) of the Constitution. Interim order by High Court was set aside, and the case was remanded for jurisdiction determination.
Decision_or_verdict: Case remanded; High Court's interim order set aside.
legal_arguments: Jurisdiction of High Court barred under Article 212(2) of the Constitution.
Matters of civil servant postings fall within Service Tribunal's exclusive jurisdiction.
key_issues: Jurisdiction of High Court in civil servant transfer disputes

legal_terms.Service Tribunal: A specialized tribunal for resolving disputes related to civil servant service matters.

words_and_phrases.Inter se transfers: Transfers between two individuals within the same department.

summary_vector_notes: Supreme Court clarified jurisdictional boundaries under Article 212(2) of the Constitution, emphasizing Service Tribunal's role in civil servant disputes.
